intro: Kengyilia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered kengyilia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, adding a vibrant touch to the alpine landscape. Kengyilia laxiflora is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
